title: 'I have some gas left in the tank': At 37, Djokovic still has big tennis goals
description: Djokovic has had a rough start to 2025, but shown flashes of brilliance too. And he's aiming for that 100th tour win.
author: Simon Cambers

title: 'Aggressive' Gauff sweeps aside sluggish Swiatek
description: Coco Gauff overpowered defending champion Iga Swiatek 6-1, 6-1 to reach the Madrid Open singles final for the first time.
author: Associated Press

title: Draper set for world top five after beating Arnaldi
description: British number one Jack Draper cruises past Italy's Matteo Arnaldi 6-0 6-4 to reach the semi-finals of the Madrid Open and move into the top five in the world.

title: Gauff thrashes Swiatek at Madrid Open
description: Coco Gauff produces a stunning display to thrash four-time French Open champion Iga Swiatek 6-1 6-1 and reach the final of the Madrid Open.

title: What is the Madrid tennis schedule?
description: The Mutua Madrid Open continues on Friday, with Casper Ruud set to face Francisco Cerundolo in the semi-finals before Jack Draper faces Lorenzo Musetti.  View Friday’s full order of play below. ORDER OF PLAY - FRIDAY, 02 MAY 2025 Manolo Santana Stadium - start 1:30 PM WTA - Victoria Azarenka / Ashlyn Krueger (USA) vs Veronika Kudermetova / Elise Mertens (BEL) Not Before 4:00 PM ATP - [20] Francisco Cerundolo (ARG) vs [14] Casper Ruud (NOR) Not Before 8:00 PM ATP - [5] Jack Draper (GBR) vs [10] Lorenzo Musetti (ITA) WTA - Sorana Cirstea (ROU) / Anna Kalinskaya vs [3] Su-Wei Hsieh (TPE) / Jelena Ostapenko (LAT) Arantxa Sanchez Stadium - start 1:30 PM ATP - [3] Kevin Krawietz (GER) / Tim Puetz (GER) vs [5] Marcel Granollers (ESP) / Horacio Zeballos (ARG) Not Before 5:00 PM ATP - [1] Marcelo Arevalo (ESA) / Mate Pavic (CRO) vs Christian Harrison (USA) / Evan King (USA) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What were the Mutua Madrid Open results?
description: The 2025 Mutua Madrid Open continued on Thursday, when Jack Draper secured his place in the Top 5 with a quarter-final win. Casper Ruud claimed his first Lexus ATP Head2Head win against Daniil Medvedev. Francisco Cerundolo overcame Jakub Mensik and Lorenzo Musetti also advanced. View all the Madrid results from Thursday below. Results - Thursday, 01 May 2025 Men's Singles - Quarterfinal ATP - [14] Casper Ruud (NOR) d [9] Daniil Medvedev 63 75 ATP - [10] Lorenzo Musetti (ITA) d [LL] Gabriel Diallo (CAN) 64 63 ATP - [20] Francisco Cerundolo (ARG) d [22] Jakub Mensik (CZE) 36 76(5) 62 ATP - [5] Jack Draper (GBR) d Matteo Arnaldi (ITA) 60 64 Men's Doubles - Quarterfinal ATP - [5] Marcel Granollers (ESP)/Horacio Zeballos (ARG) d [2] Harri Heliovaara (FIN)/Henry Patten (GBR) 76(3) 63 ATP - [1] Marcelo Arevalo (ESA)/Mate Pavic (CRO) d [6] Nikola Mektic (CRO)/Michael Venus (NZL) 67(5) 64 10-5 ATP - [3] Kevin Krawietz (GER)/Tim Puetz (GER) d Sander Gille (BEL)/Jan Zielinski (POL) 63 64 ATP - Christian Harrison (USA)/Evan King (USA) d Maximo Gonzalez (ARG)/Andres Molteni (ARG) 64 62 View Friday Madrid Schedule View Madrid Prize Money [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Madrid Open 2025 Day 9 Recap
description: The 2025 Mutua Madrid Open hit its stride on day nine, delivering plenty of action as all four men’s quarter-finals played out at La Caja Mágica. From Casper Ruud proving his clay-court prowess to Jack Draper’s hammering of Arnaldi, Francisco Cerúndolo’s hard-fought comeback, and Lorenzo Musetti’s mental toughness, the stage is now set for Friday’s …
author: Jonathan

title: Madrid Open 2025 Day 8 Recap
description: Day eight at the Madrid Open brought things closer to the business end of the tournament, with the bottom half of the draw completing their round of sixteen matches. Matteo Arnaldi and Jack Draper punched their tickets to the last eight during the day session, with Arnaldi upsetting Frances Tiafoe and Draper cruising past Tommy …
author: Jonathan
